The meeting discussed the latest results of the PLP configuration on development test data for Hub-5 test set. The recognition performance was exactly the same as with the Mel Cepstra front-end. The males were slightly better and the females were slightly worse, but nothing significant. The combination of the two systems resulted in a one and a half percent improvement. The SRI system wants to combine the two systems for the next evaluation. The Hub-5 system does well on digits because it contains a lot of read speech data. The people who train the digit recognizers can use something other than TI-digits. The dictionary made a huge difference in the performance of the hybrid system. The alignment from Decipher was a good starting point for the initial alignments. The hybrid system never got better than about 50% error rate. The dictionary was never fixed and the system never adapted. The embedded training may improve the performance of the tandem system. The size of the net should be at least 2000 hidden units. The two thousand hidden unit net is almost as good as the four thousand hidden unit net and is faster.
